meanings.definition: To plant seeds again in an area.
meanings.sent1: After the storm, the farmer began reseeding his fields to grow new crops.
meanings.sent2: Gardeners often reseed their flower beds in the spring to ensure beautiful blooms.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels kept digging up the reseeded area, thinking they had hidden their acorns there.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like reseeding hope in a barren heart, bringing new life to a desolate soul.
meanings.sent5: The reseeding process transformed the once empty land into a vibrant garden bursting with life.

meanings.definition: The act of planting seeds again in an area.
meanings.sent1: The reseeding of the meadow brought forth a colorful array of wildflowers.
meanings.sent2: Farmers rely on reseeding to replenish nutrients in the soil and maintain crop yields.
meanings.sent3: The reseeding event at the park turned into a playful seed-throwing competition.
meanings.sent4: In the garden of life, reseeding represents the cycle of renewal and growth.
meanings.sent5: The community project focused on reseeding areas affected by deforestation, aiming to restore the ecosystem.
